_header: My noble sons and eke my lords dear
Subjects: old age; precepts; advice, moral; prologues

BodAsh59.First Lines:
My noble sonnes and eke my lordes dereI your fader called
                    vnworþelySende vn to yowe þis balade folowing hereWriten of
                    myne owen hande ful rudely…
BodAsh59.Last Lines:
…God you conferme in vertuous goodnesseSo þat thorughe
                    necgligence yee no thing leese
BodAsh59.Note:
With the insertion between stanzas 13 and 14 of Chaucer’s
                    ‘Gentilesse’ — see 3348.
BodAsh59.Attributed Title:
Here foloweþe nexst a moral balade to my lord þe Prince to my
                    lord of Clarence to my lord of Bedford and to my lorde of Gloucestre by Henry
                    Scogan at a souper of feorþe merchande in þe vyntre in londoun at
                    þe hous of Lowys Johan (f. 25)
BodAsh59.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             A Parallel-Text Edition of Chaucer’s Minor Poems.
             3 vols. 
             Chaucer Society
         1st. ser. 21, 57, 58. London: Trübner, n.d. repr. New York and
            London: Johnson, 1967.

CULFf49.First Lines:
…I Complayne me sore whan I remembre meThe sodayn age
                    þat vppon me is falle…
CULFf49.Last Lines:
…To yeve vs myght to ben vertuousAnd of þis þinge
                    herkyn houw my mayster seyd

BLHar2251.First Lines:
I compleyne sore whan I remembe meThe sodayn Age that is vpon me
                    falle…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…Thow lorde of Rest and parfite vnitePut fro me vices and kepe
                    my soule heele
BLHar2251.Note: stanzas 2, 3, only, conflated with Cato Major (1418).

BLHar367.First Lines:
Mi noble sonns and eke my lords dereI yowr fathar called
                    vnworthyly…
BLHar367.Last Lines:
…that myne vnkonunge ye take beninglyfor gods sake and harken
                    what I saye
BLHar367.Note:
Stanza 1 only. Written by the hand of John Stow; followed at end of last
                    line by ‘& setra . they say it is in Chawcer’ by scribe’s,
                    John Stow’s hand.
BLHar367.Attributed Title:
Here folowed a morall ballad to the princes the duke of Clarens the duke of
                    bedford the duke of wincestar the kyngs sonns by harry scogan at a [f or s] ey
                    as amonge the marchaunts in the vintry at london in the howse of lewys jhon
                    bigininge thus (by scribe, John Stow, f. 86v)
